International degree | Admission requirements | MSc University of Twente Skip to main content Menu en Nederlands English Deutsch LatAm website Italian website Home Education Master Admission requirements You can do a master's if you are at an academic level . See if you are! Dutch Educational System The Dutch higher education is based on a binary system that distinguishes: Research-oriented higher education, which is mainly provided at research universities (WO Bachelor). Higher professional education, which is mainly provided at universities of applied sciences (HBO Bachelor). Being a research university , UT will focus on academically oriented work. That is why the admission committee assesses your prior education to see whether it corresponds with a bachelor's degree from a Dutch research university. # Source: https://www.eda.admin.ch/countries/usa/en/home/visa/residency/studying.html

Studying in Switzerland Home Visa & entry to Switzerland Living in Switzerland Studying in Switzerland Print page Studying in Switzerland In order to be able to study in Switzerland you require a proof of acceptance from the education institution where you will be studying. Depending on your nationality, with this letter you can either apply for a residence permit in a Swiss canton or submit a visa application to the Swiss representation covering your country of residence. Students at the Rolex Learning Centre library, Ecole polytechnique f√©d√©rale de Lausanne. ¬© FDFA, Presence Switzerland Apply for Admission Contact the school or university of your choice prior to the admission deadline. Most of the universities also accept online applications. Master's admission and application - Leiden University Skip to main content Master's admission and application Find out how to apply for one of Leiden University‚Äôs master's programmes by following our step-by step guide in the application and admission section. We look forward to receiving your application! Step-by step guide This guide clearly explains the steps you need to take to apply, and the subsequent admission process. Step 1: Check the admission requirements Step 2: Check the application deadlines Step 3: Collect the required documents Step 4: Start your application Step 5: Pay your tuition fees Step 6: Prepare for your studies at Leiden University Every programme at Leiden University has its own entry requirements, application procedure and deadlines. Find out how to apply for your programme by following the step-by step guide in the application and admission section of each programme

Study programmes - Study in Sweden Study programmes Choose between finding study programmes through subject areas or universities. Filter Subject areas Universities Found 17 subject areas Agriculture, Horticulture, Forestry and Fishery Forests. Fish. Wildlife. They‚Äôre pretty important to us ‚Äì and to the planet, as it goes. Here in Sweden, we‚Äôre in love with our environment, and we‚Äôre fiercely protective of it. That‚Äôs why we give students who share our passion for a sustainable future the know-how they need to start shaping it. Just take a look around. Acres and acres (and acres) of lush greenery, dotted with literally thousands of lakes. Added to that: an appetite for innovation in Agriculture, Horticulture, Forestry and Fishery that you won‚Äôt find anywhere else. Who says you have to focus on one specialism? Not us!
